Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the alpha-defensin family (Theta subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus 502a, Listeria monocytogenes;Gram-negative bacteria:Salmonella typhimurium, Escherichia coli ML35.Fungi:Candida albicans 16820, Cryptococcus neoformans 271A (the activity of RTD-2 against Escherichia coli ML35 was 2-3-fold less than those of RTD-1 and RTD-3).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: RTD-1 and RTD-3 have similar antimicrobial activities against the Gram-positive bacteria, the Gram-negative bacteria and the fungi C. albicans 16820 and C. neoformans 271A.
Sequence Information.PTM: Forms a cyclic peptide with subunit A (RTD-3) or with subunit B (RTD-1). An additional intersubunit disulfide bond is formed. Subunit structure RTD-1 is a cyclic heterodimer composed of subunits A and B; disulfide-linked. RTD-3 is a cyclic homodimer composed of two subunits A; disulfide-linked. RTD-1 is 10-fold more present in cells than RTD-3.

Literature.Title: A cyclic antimicrobial peptide produced in primate leukocytes by the ligation of two truncated alpha-defensins.
Literature.Author: Tang YQ, Yuan J, Osapay G, Osapay K, Tran D, Miller CJ, Ouellette AJ, Selsted ME.

Literature.Title: Circular minidefensins and posttranslational generation of molecular diversity.
Literature.Author: Leonova L, Kokryakov VN, Aleshina G, Hong T, Nguyen T, Zhao C, Waring AJ, Lehrer RI.

Literature.Title: Homodimeric theta-defensins from rhesus macaque leukocytes isolation, synthesis, antimicrobial activities, and bacterial binding properties of the cyclic peptides.
Literature.Author: Tran D, Tran PA, Tang YQ, Yuan J, Cole T, Selsted ME.
